issue.title: fix: synchronize session on all deletes

repository.name: fonduer
repository.description: A knowledge base construction engine for richly formatted data

issue.body:
Note that this does have some performance implications [[1]](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/query.html):

> The 'fetch' strategy results in an additional SELECT statement emitted and will significantly reduce performance.

But some overhead in performance when running `clear` and `clear_all()` seems worth it if it eliminates the sqlalchemy error.

See #213.

body: Reopening. This is still an issue.
Do we still observe this issue?

I've just observed the same error message (not sure if it is exactly the same issue) during `candidate_extractor.apply`
I'm using Fonduer Version: 0.4.0.

```

---> 96                     value = sub_evaluate(obj)

--> 881         raise orm_exc.ObjectDeletedError(state)

```

In my case, 
```
for i, docs in enumerate([train_docs, dev_docs, test_docs]):
    session.query(Candidate).filter(Candidate.split == i).delete(synchronize_session="fetch")
```
works just fine. Maybe `filter(Candidate.type == candidate_class.__tablename__)` is doing wrong.
https://github.com/HazyResearch/fonduer/blob/7a5df470addb8cacaeed927422e0255b36e0e3a4/src/fonduer/candidates/candidates.py#L127-L129

issue.title: Parser.clear() does not clear until session.commit() is executed

repository.name: fonduer
repository.description: A knowledge base construction engine for richly formatted data

issue.body:
## Description of the bug

`Parser.clear()` does not clear anything until `session.commit()` is executed elsewhere.
According to https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/session_basics.html#deleting, 
> The Session.delete() method places an instance into the Sessions list of objects to be marked as deleted

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```python
>>> corpus_parser.apply(doc_preprocessor)
>>> corpus_parser.clear()
>>> assert session.query(Document).count() == 0
```

## Expected behavior

When `corpus_parser.clear()` above is executed, any instance of `Context` like `Document`, `Sentence` should be deleted.

## Error Logs/Screenshots
If applicable, add error logs or screenshots to help explain your problem.

## Environment (please complete the following information)
 - Fonduer Version: 0.8.2

## Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

This might be related to #213
